overview_of_class:
This course will survey the Classical Arabic literary tradition with an emphasis on early Islamic literature. Our readings will include religious texts, grammar and linguistics and philosophy. We will read, analyze and discuss samples of works by masters of the adab literary type such as al-Jahiz. (Abbasid period), al-Ghazali, al-Hallaj and Ibn-?Arabi (Islamic mysticism ), Ibn Jinni (linguistics) and Ibn Khaldoun ( philosophy of history).We will also examine selections from the writings of Ibn Rushd and Ibn Sina (Two landmarks of Islamic Philosophy).

In this course we will work intensely on improving reading-for-comprehension skills. However, we will continue to strengthen Arabic writing skills through writing assignments that reflect students abilities of understanding and assimilating the texts.

Listening and speaking skills will continue to be improved through in class oral discussions. Special exercises will be developed to improve students understanding and use of essential elements of rhetoric (????????? ??????? ? ??????? ? ?????? ? ???????? ???) and apply them to the texts they read in class.

The course offers a valuable chance to students who want to explore Arab literary traditions in depth. It also provides foundational skills for students who want to pursue graduate careers in Arabic literature or Middle eastern Studies.
name: Reading Classical Arabic Texts (in Arabic)
subject: ARABIC
